Get timezone from lat/lon

Get timezone from lat/lon

tz_calc(coords = NULL, lat = NULL, lon = NULL, etc = FALSE)

Arguments

coords

Vector or Data frame. Lat, lon coordinates. Can be a vector for a set of two, or a data frame or matrix for multiple. Provide either coords OR lat and lon
lat

Vector. One or more latitudes, must also provide longitude
lon

Vector. One or more longitudes, must also provide latitude
etc

Logical. Return Etc timezone? Non-daylight savings offset only.

Examples


# Daylight savings
tz_calc(lat = 53.881857, lon = -122.786271)
#> [1] "America/Vancouver"
tz_calc(coords = c(53.881857, -122.786271))
#> [1] "America/Vancouver"

# No daylight savings
tz_calc(lat = 53.881857, lon = -122.786271, etc = TRUE)
#> [1] "Etc/GMT+8"
tz_calc(coords = c(53.881857, -122.786271), etc = TRUE)
#> [1] "Etc/GMT+8"
